title: Error during frame labeling with GUI
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** Windows 10, anaconda environment. DLC 2.1.10.4 Please complete the following information about your system: OS: Windows 10 DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.10.4 Anaconda env used: DLC-GPU **Describe the problem** When I am labeling frames with the GUI (this is a multi animal project) nothing happens when I hit "next". If I save and exit, then come back, it will start at the next frame. The actual labeling seems to be working fine. Please place code inside this:
RuntimeError Traceback (most recent call last) ~\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.py in nextImage(self, event) 1068 """ 1069 self.individualrdb.SetSelection(0) -> 1070 MainFrame.select_individual(self, event) 1071 # Checks for the last image and disables the Next button 1072 if len(self.index) - self.iter == 1: ~\Anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\gui\multiple_individuals_labeling_toolbox.py in select_individual(self, event) 1010 def select_individual(self, event): 1011 individualName = self.individualrdb.GetStringSelection() -> 1012 self.change_marker_size.Hide() 1013 self.change_marker_size.Destroy() 1014 if individualName == "single": RuntimeError: wrapped C/C++ object of type Slider has been deleted

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to 'label frames' tab 2. Click on 'label frames' 3. Click on 'load frames' 4. Label animals 5. Click on "next" 6. see error **Screenshots** n/a **Additional context** none
